gw.api.effdate

Class EffDatedFinderUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.effdate.EffDatedFinderUtil

  • public class EffDatedFinderUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for commonly needed query enhancements on effective dated entities
    Author:
    dmccreary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addEffectiveDatedRestrictionsToColumns(IQueryBuilder restriction, java.util.Date date, IColumnPropertyInfo effectiveDateProp, IColumnPropertyInfo expirationDateProp)
      Add effective dated constraints to the given restriction on the given columns You should prefer to use addRestrictionsForEffectiveOnDate(gw.api.database.IQueryBuilder, java.util.Date) if at all possible.
      static void addRestrictionsForEffectiveOnDate(IQueryBuilder restriction, java.util.Date date)
      Add standard effective dated constraints to the given restriction
      static void addZeroWidthRestrictions(IQueryBuilder restriction)
      Add constraints to the given restriction to avoid zero-width eff-dated entities (e.g. an eff-dated where EffectiveDate == ExpirationDate)

    • Method Detail

      • addRestrictionsForEffectiveOnDate

        public static void addRestrictionsForEffectiveOnDate(IQueryBuilder restriction,
                                                     java.util.Date date)
        Add standard effective dated constraints to the given restriction
        Parameters:
        restriction - the restriction to be modified
        date - the date to be considered, the effective date must be <= date < expiration date

      • addEffectiveDatedRestrictionsToColumns

        public static void addEffectiveDatedRestrictionsToColumns(IQueryBuilder restriction,
                                                          java.util.Date date,
                                                          IColumnPropertyInfo effectiveDateProp,
                                                          IColumnPropertyInfo expirationDateProp)
        Add effective dated constraints to the given restriction on the given columns You should prefer to use addRestrictionsForEffectiveOnDate(gw.api.database.IQueryBuilder, java.util.Date) if at all possible. If you don't find this to be possible, you should think carefully about your use case.
        Parameters:
        restriction - the restriction to be modified
        date - the date to be considered, the effective date must be <= date < expiration date
        effectiveDateProp - the property which represents the effective date on this table
        expirationDateProp - the property which represents the expiration date on this table

      • addZeroWidthRestrictions

        public static void addZeroWidthRestrictions(IQueryBuilder restriction)
        Add constraints to the given restriction to avoid zero-width eff-dated entities (e.g. an eff-dated where EffectiveDate == ExpirationDate)
        Parameters:
        restriction - the restriction to be modified
